message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to show you this amazing product. I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $12,000. It's a great deal, if I do say so myself!
Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I'm not willing to pay $12,000.  I'm interested in the product, but I'm only willing to pay $9,000 for it.  Let's see if we can find some common ground.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $12,000 might be a stretch for you, but I'm not willing to go as low as $9,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $10,500. It's still a great deal, and I think you'll really love the product.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to come down on the price, but $10,500 is still a bit too high for me.  I'm willing to offer $10,000, which is what I would pay John for the product.  This is my final offer.

I understand that $10,000 is your final offer, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product for that price. I think it's worth more than that, and I'm willing to stand firm on my price. I'm willing to offer you a compromise: I'll sell the product to you for $10,200. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.
